title: Huntsville father charged in death of young daughter
content:
A Huntsville father is accused of shooting his 20-month-old daughter Friday evening during a domestic dispute.
Lionel Francis, 34, was initially arrested and charged with attempted murder, according to Huntsville police.
The charges were upgraded to capital murder on Saturday afternoon after his daughter died at Children's of Alabama in Birmingham.
The shooting occurred at around 6:20 p.m. in the 3300 block of Lockwood Court.
Huntsville police say Francis intentionally shot his young daughter during an argument with the girl's mother.
Following the shooting, Francis went outside and waited on officers to arrive. He was taken into custody without incident at the scene.
The investigation remains ongoing.
